programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Detroit went for it on fourth down for a fifth time to set up Jake Bates' 35-yard field goal as time expired, Jared Goff threw three touchdown passes and the Lions clinched a playoff spot with a 34-31 victory over the Green Bay Packers.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Quarterback Joe Burrow leads the Cincinnati Bengals to victory during Christmas Week with a 3 touchdown performance connecting with wide receiver Tee Higgins for all 3 scores including an overtime touchdown to keep the Bengals in the playoff race.

programme.title: Game of the Week
programme.desc: Jayden Daniels ran for a season-high 127 yards and completed 24 of 36 passes for 227 yards to make the playoffs in his rookie year while casting a shadow over his rookie QB opponent in Michael Penix Jr.

programme.title: NFL Explained: Evolution of Free Agency
programme.desc: From early bidding wars to today's biggest contracts, a look back at how free agency has evolved throughout NFL history.

programme.title: 40s and Free Agents: NFL Draft Season
programme.desc: NFL's top Free Agency and NFL Draft Insiders Daniel Jeremiah and Greg Rosenthal examine the emerging storylines and names each week ahead of the 2025 NFL Draft.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Browns running back Nick Chubb scored a 2-yard, go-ahead touchdown with 57 seconds left, and Steelers quarterback Russell Wilson's Hail Mary attempt was batted down in the end zone as time expired as Cleveland wins in the snow 24-19 over Pittsburgh.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: New York Jets wide receiver Garrett Wilson made a dazzling 26-yard go-ahead touchdown catch early in the fourth quarter and the New York Jets snapped a five-game losing streak by beating the Houston Texans 21-13 on a Halloween edition of Thursday Night Football.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: Passed over by every NFL team, John Randle's madcap antics vaulted the undrafted free agent from rags to riches and stardom with the Minnesota Vikings and Seattle Seahawks.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Los Angeles Chargers play the Pittsburgh Steelers at Acrisure Stadium on September 22, 2024.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: During the matchup between the New Orleans Saints and the Minnesota Vikings, a last-minute 61-yard touchdown by Stefon Diggs gave Minnesota a 29-24 victory over New Orleans to send the Vikings to the NFC championship game.

programme.title: NFL Explained: Evolution of Free Agency
programme.desc: From early bidding wars to today's biggest contracts, a look back at how free agency has evolved throughout NFL history.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Flacco fired a 15-yard touchdown pass to rookie Garrett Wilson with 22 seconds left as the Jets rallied for an improbable 31-30 win over the stunned Cleveland Browns, who blew a two-touchdown lead in the final two minutes Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Josh Allen threw for 329 yards and three touchdowns, including the go-ahead toss to Dawson Knox with 1:04 left, and the Bills held on for a 24-20 victory against Mahomes and Chiefs.

programme.title: Episode 7
programme.desc: Who is the real ‘Loose Cannon’? Lily Newhouse is the amateur who qualified to play in this high stakes cash game. But it’s Las Vegas businessman Dave Krosky who’s confusing pros like Sam Grafton with his unpredictable playing style.

programme.title: Episode 8
programme.desc: More high stakes action from Las Vegas. ‘Loose Cannon’ Lily Newhouse switches up her style, while local entrepreneur Dave Krosky sticks to his maverick methods. But have the pros finally started to figure him out?

programme.title: Episode 9
programme.desc: The penultimate session of this high stakes cash games sees Las Vegas businessman Dave Krosky test the patience of his opponents. Meanwhile, pro players Maria Ho and Sam Grafton clash in a huge pot.

programme.title: Episode 10
programme.desc: The pressure is on, as this high stakes Vegas poker game concludes. Loose Cannon Lily only has a few hands left to make a profit. Can she find a spot? Meanwhile, Dave is playing wilder than ever.

programme.title: Doubles Poker Championship
programme.desc: Thirty-two of the best professional poker players in the world buy in for $50,000 apiece, but there's a twist. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. programme.title: Toughest Gun in Tombstone
programme.desc: Before initiating an undercover investigation in Tombstone, Ariz., Capt. Matt Sloane (George Montgomery) sets out to build a reputation for himself as a ruthless man. Sloane distributes "wanted" circulars describing his supposed criminal exploits; drops off his young son, Terry (Scotty Morrow), with a friend; and joins a vicious gang headed up by his target: reckless outlaw Johnny Ringo (Jim Davis). As Sloane works his way into Ringo's inner circle, Terry flees home in search of his father.

programme.title: King of the Wild Stallions

programme.title: Robbers' Roost
programme.desc: An outlaw attempting to go straight while tracking down one of his wife's killers, Jim "Tex" Wall (George Montgomery) finds work on a ranch operated by disabled cattle owner "Bull" Herrick (Bruce Bennett). As Tex begins to fall for Bull's pretty sister, Helen (Sylvia Findley), he also has to face off against two feuding gangs of rustlers, one led by the tough Heesman (Peter Graves). Can Tex escape his shady past and finally end his mission of vengeance?

programme.title: Gunsight Ridge
programme.desc: Gunslinger Mike Ryan (Joel McCrea) is intent on bringing the dangerous outlaw Velvet Clark (Mark Stevens) to justice. However, Ryan is at a disadvantage, since he doesn't know what the masked robber looks like. Ryan begins to work with the area sheriff and falls for the lawman's pretty daughter, Molly Jones (Joan Weldon). With Clark hiding in plain sight as a piano player, the criminal manages to evade Ryan for a while, but eventually the two adversaries come face-to-face.

programme.title: The Gunfight at Dodge City
programme.desc: Gambler and gunman Bat Masterson (Joel McCrea) rides into Dodge City, Kan., to visit his straight-arrow brother, Ed (Harry Lauter), who is hoping to defeat crooked sheriff Jim Regan (Don Haggerty) in an upcoming election. Bat purchases and renovates a rundown saloon, attracting the notice of Regan's henchmen. A shooting during the saloon's opening-night celebration causes Bat to pursue his own political vendetta against Regan and attempt to clean up the town's corruption once and for all.

programme.title: Trooper Hook
programme.desc: Wanted for killing a squadron of soldiers, Apache Chief Nanchez (Rudolfo Acosta) is finally captured by Sgt. Clovis Hook (Joel McCrea), who discovers among Nanchez's prisoners Cora Sutliff (Barbara Stanwyck), who had been missing for several years. Sutliff has not only fully integrated into the Apache way of life, she also has a son with Nanchez. Now Hook wants to transport her back to her old way of life, but Nanchez isn't willing to let his son be taken from him.

programme.title: Ambush
programme.desc: The year is 1878, and the young daughter of a U.S. general is kidnapped and taken far into the Apache lands of the Arizona Territory. Prospector Ward Kinsman (Robert Taylor) is enlisted to find the girl because he knows the area well. Though Ward is initially skeptical of the dangerous task, he changes his tune when he finds out that the captive's gorgeous sister, Ann (Arlene Dahl), will be coming along. Unfortunately, their mission and potential romance is soon interrupted by an Apache attack.

programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.desc: Darlene figures out a plan to afford Mark's college tuition; Jackie and Louise try to help Becky meet a guy.

programme.desc: Neville confronts Jackie about loaning Dan money; Darlene attempts to play matchmaker for Mark.

programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.desc: Bev experiences moments of clarity and reflection and asks Jackie to spend the day together in Chicago.

programme.desc: Mark adjusts to his first day of college as a commuter student.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene crashes Mark’s college trivia night to prove how smart she is.

programme.desc: Darlene urges Ben to make some male friends as he feels anxious about turning 50.

programme.desc: The hardware store suffers a smash and grab and Dan and Jackie hold one of the culprits.

programme.desc: Darlene seeks to be manager of food services at Mark’s college after feeling they could use some organization.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners relish national cheeseball day. Harris falls behind in her work at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is asked to write an article for a Hardware magazine, making Ben miss his days as a writer.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A fire at Ben’s hardware store causes a major setback for the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan achieves a major financial milestone, reconsidering his belief in the ‘Conners curse.’

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark takes on odd jobs, determined to find a way to pay for school.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.desc: Darlene’s thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The Winter Blob makes a welcome appearance to send the contestants into orbit whilst Granny’s House.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight's program sees Gordon Ramsay in Oscars in Nantwich. On the surface this place seems idyllic, an Irish family run restaurant in the heart of beautiful countryside. Owner MAURA runs the front of house and her son LENIN is the Head chef, but it's not "happy families". With her life savings on the line Maura is in big trouble. She constantly bickers with her son whilst the customers are forced to wait hours for their fluorescent crab stick paellas, and stodgy carbonaras from Oscars "bit of everything" menu.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings throughout the seasons. Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey in Cambridgeshire, a garden designed to look its best in winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This week we are celebrating the work of the army of volunteers, which keeps gardens up and down the country looking their best for visitors. Frances Tophill continues her vegetable trials at RHS Rosemoor in Devon, when she plants out her allotment with the help of RHS volunteers and we visit the Bodnant Garden in North Wales to find out how the volunteers there guide visitors through the world famous Laburnum Arch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Tender vegetables, bedding plants and bees are the focus of Monty's gardening at Longmeadow as he plants out squashes and scented annuals, and harvests honey. Adam Frost is in London, looking at how small spaces in the metropolis can be utilised to make gardens for wildlife, food and relaxation. Also, we visit North Wales to meet a man with a passion for prehistoric plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the longest day of the year approaches, there's more time to be outside and enjoy the garden and Monty is no exception. Although some vegetables do not respond well to a late sowing, there are others that do and Monty gives his tips on late croppers to sow now. Carol Klein and Joe Swift make a visit to Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham to revel in the hundreds of summer flowering plants on display and to find design tips for small gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Whilst celebrating the glory of summer flowers at Longmeadow, Monty has plenty of tips, from pruning and propagation techniques for different types of clematis to troubleshooting problems with roses. Carol Klein wades through streams and marshes to show us how gardeners can emulate nature when choosing the right water plants for our gardens, and we visit Norfolk to revel in an extraordinary collection of iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is reaping the rewards of the summer when he begins to harvest crops from the vegetable garden and gives tips on extending the flower season in the borders. Carol takes a trip to the seaside to discover why some plants thrive, despite being assaulted by salt-laden winds. We make a final visit to Sissinghurst, to catch up with Troy Scott-Smith and the changes that have been made to the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer gets into full swing, there is plenty for Monty to be doing at Longmeadow. He gets to grips with summer pruning as he tackles his espaliered pear trees. Nature's bounty is very much in evidence at Lord Rothschild's garden at Waddesdon Manor, where we get an exclusive look behind the scenes. Also, Joe Swift ponders ways of putting a contemporary twist on traditional bedding plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Now that the rambling roses have finished flowering, Monty turns his attention to pruning and tying in new growth for a good display next year. On the 20th anniversary of the death of Geoff Hamilton, Adam Frost returns to the famous `Gardeners' World' location, Barnsdale, to pay tribute and to revisit some his own early gardening memories. Also, we travel to Abergavenny to visit the garden of a sweet pea enthusiast to get her top tips for growing the best blooms.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift pays a visit to the Northumberland garden of Chris Mullin who, after over twenty years as a Member of Parliament, has turned his attention to the renovation of his walled garden. And National Trust head gardener, Alan Power, catches up with the transformation of Shakespeare's New Place garden in Stratford-upon-Avon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Now that birds are no longer nesting in hedges, now is the time to get them looking trim and neat and Monty has plenty of tips on how to cut them so that they grow well. Alan Power visits Croome Park in Worcestershire to discover more about one of the first great landscapes of Capability Brown and we visit a couple in Gloucestershire whose ornamental grass garden was inspired by the Far East.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Kew on a Plate
programme.desc: It is spring at Kew and after a long, dark winter, nature is coming back to life. Raymond makes his sublime version of rhubarb and custard and Kate finds out how a 12-year-old slave enabled vanilla to become the world's most popular flavour.

programme.title: Kew on a Plate
programme.desc: Summer has arrived at Kew and everything in Raymond Blanc and Kate Humble's garden is blooming. Butterflies and bees abound and there are new crops to tend, harvest and cook with. Everyone loves a carrot, particularly the carrot fly, so Raymond must protect his crop to ensure he has a good supply for his summer carrot stew.

programme.title: Kew on a Plate
programme.desc: It's autumn at Kew and the vegetable garden is set to produce a bumper harvest. Raymond Blanc and Kate Humble grow some autumnal favourites and cook them up. Kate finds out why the tomato was once considered to be a deadly poison.

programme.title: Kew on a Plate
programme.desc: The end of the year at Kew is fast approaching, winter is setting in, but some crops positively love the cold and Raymond learns how brassicas cope in this frosty season. Kate visits Kew's Millennium Seed Bank.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the bank holiday ahead there's plenty of opportunity to catch up with some essential jobs in the garden and Monty gives a masterclass on how to look after and prune soft fruit to ensure maximum production next year. Frances Tophill is at RHS Rosemoor where she is catching up on her vegetable trials which she started earlier in the year, and Alan Power visits Hestercombe Gardens in Somerset to find out more about the discovery of a long lost gladiolus.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the regular team are joined by some new faces offering tips, advice and inspiration from gardens large and small across the country. In this programme Monty is at Longmeadow catching up with some seasonal jobs, and also getting out and about for an inspiring visit to the longest herbaceous border in the world.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouri’s gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the “Show Me” state in search of mature whitetail bucks. programme.title: Winchester Life

Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

With trips earlier in the year cancelled, Josh and Hattie were invited to join the TTHA crew at G2 ranch. programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Throughout the years, our friendships have been forged in deer camps across the country, and this week is a continuation of some of those times. programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: After adventuring around the USA Danny decided to compete in a good old fashioned Bass Tournament in his home town.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: Turkey season is officially in full swing. Phillip Culpepper heads to Mississippi to meet up with old friends and hunt the season opener. After scouting up a flock of turkeys the day before, Culpepper sets up the next morning and works a longbeard right into the decoys. Shortly after, producer Matt Garger buys his license and is up-to-bat.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: Spring Thunder heads North to turkey hunt New York State. Realtree video producer Matt Garger grew up turkey hunting New York State, but with limited ground to hunt, the guys hit a mix of public and permission ground to find gobblers. Using their OnX maps to secure turkey hunting ground, the guys are able to double up on two New York Longbeards!!

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: Spring Thunder heads to Oklahoma to hunt CRAZY springtime gobbler action.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: It's the next Grand Slam stop. The Spring Thunder crew hunts eastern wild turkeys in Georgia. They get there just in the nick of time. When they arrive at producer James Thompsons' farm, a screaming bird is waiting for them.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: Low turkey population densities and the rocky, steep terrain of New York State's Adirondack Mountains create a unique spring turkey hunting challenge only found in this region of the country. It's not always easy to find wild turkeys here, but when you can, there is always the chance that this bird has never been hunted making success particularly special.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach and Carson Wentz spend a couple years chasing a buck in New Jersey they call Ghost.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Few freshwater species are more steeped in lore than North America's native muskellunge. Sporting the nickname "The fish of ten thousand casts," musky remains unchecked on the bucket list of many casual and committed anglers. Spencer Berman caught and landed his first "by accident," a fortuitous but ultimately fateful encounter. "I got bit by the musky bug at a young age," he says, and it appears the bug is alive and well. “It drives me to be better, do better, fish longer, work harder, put more into it, do more prep work, to check each and every component. I’m forever and always willing to make ‘one more cast.”

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.
Get ready for one of the best seasons yet from Team200! From giant elk to monster bears and a couple 200″ whitetails, you don’t want to miss a single episode from Team200 this year!
Chris Schmidt and his son Hunter go after some big east coast bucks and a whopper of a bruin before closing out the season in Kansas.

programme.title: Spring Thunder

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Few freshwater species are more steeped in lore than North America's native muskellunge. Sporting the nickname "The fish of ten thousand casts," musky remains unchecked on the bucket list of many casual and committed anglers. Spencer Berman caught and landed his first "by accident," a fortuitous but ultimately fateful encounter. "I got bit by the musky bug at a young age," he says, and it appears the bug is alive and well. “It drives me to be better, do better, fish longer, work harder, put more into it, do more prep work, to check each and every component. I’m forever and always willing to make ‘one more cast.”

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in America…the wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.
Get ready for one of the best seasons yet from Team200! From giant elk to monster bears and a couple 200″ whitetails, you don’t want to miss a single episode from Team200 this year!

programme.desc: During WW II, Lt. Rip Crandall and his inexperienced and motley crew get assigned to deliver an Australian observer to a Japanese-held island.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: A World War II classic about the violence, quarrels, and romantic intrigue affecting a group of soldiers at Pearl Harbor before the tragic attack.

programme.title: Brief Moment
programme.desc: Based on a play by S.N. Behrman.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: The Ambushers
programme.desc: When an experimental flying saucer is brought down in Mexico, secret agent Matt Helm is sent to find it and keep it from falling into enemy hands.

programme.title: Fail Safe
programme.desc: A malfunction inadvertently sends American planes armed with nuclear warheads to Russia in a blunder of potentially apocalyptic proportions.

programme.title: Decameron Nights
programme.desc: While trying to woo a noblewoman in Florence, Italian poet Boccaccio tells three tales of love in this romance based on the author's writings.

programme.title: Convicted
programme.desc: During a barroom brawl, Joe Hufford (Glenn Ford) accidentally kills the son of a powerful, prominent man. The district attorney, George Knowland (Broderick Crawford), wins a manslaughter conviction, despite having doubts about the defendant's guilt. Joe is sent to prison, and George, who eventually becomes the warden there, hopes to get him released. But Joe gets so immersed in the culture and codes of the jailhouse that he finds it difficult to believe in his own innocence.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The long-standing bond between two small-time smugglers sailing around the Caribbean is threatened when a gorgeous siren seeks passage on their boat.

programme.title: Drive a Crooked Road
programme.desc: Auto mechanic Mickey must give up his dream of becoming a professional race car driver after he is fooled into being a chump for some gangsters.

programme.title: Three on a Couch
programme.desc: An artist hopes to move to Paris, but his psychiatrist fiancée fears abandoning her patients, so he dons various disguises to cure the lonesome women.

programme.title: You Were Never Lovelier
programme.desc: Bob Davis (Fred Astaire), an American dancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finds himself desperate for work after losing all his money. He takes a gig at a wedding, hoping to impress the bride's father, Eduardo Acuña (Adolphe Menjou), a local club owner who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age. Eduardo eventually agrees to allow Bob to perform at his club, but only under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter, the beautiful Maria (Rita Hayworth).

programme.title: Good Neighbor Sam
programme.desc: A happily married advertising agent helps out his single neighbor by posing as her husband so she can inherit a 15 million dollar fortune.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Víctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an exposé of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiancée (Luz Márquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: Sierra Stranger
programme.desc: Jess Collins, a poor miner, helps Sonny chase off two men he calls claim jumpers. When he arrives in the nearby town, he learns Sonny is no good and everyone in town is against him.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: Bait
programme.desc: A reclusive Briton (John Hurt) uses a young woman (Rachael Stirling) who looks like his daughter to set a trap and find her killer.

programme.title: The Texan Meets Calamity Jane
programme.desc: Calamity Jane's rightful ownership of a gambling hall is challenged but a Texas lawyer puts up a sensational legal battle to help her stay in charge.

programme.title: The Legend of Tom Dooley
programme.desc: A Confederate officer is accused of murder when he carries out an ambush on a Union stagecoach after the war has ended.

programme.title: Conquest of Cochise
programme.desc: A cavalry major (Robert Stack) sides with Apache chief Cochise (John Hodiak) against Comanches after the Gadsden Purchase.

programme.title: Riders of the Badlands
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger's uncanny resemblance to a wanted outlaw results in his own arrest by a fellow lawman.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: Searching for work, cowboy Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small town, where he badly injures his hand. Fortunately, a local rancher, Shep Horgan (Ernest Borgnine), is willing to employ Troop despite the injury. Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.

programme.title: Apache Ambush
programme.desc: On a cattle drive to Kansas after the Civil War, an ex-Union soldier comes up against Apache and Confederate renegades.

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: After fleeing a sheriff's escort to jail, an outlaw thief crosses paths with a mysterious stranger and a greedy rancher en route to his stash of gold.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: Battle of Rogue River
programme.desc: A cavalry major (George Montgomery) makes peace with Indians despite an agitator (Richard Denning) working for carpetbaggers.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men
programme.desc: Rancher John Stewart (Randolph Scott) prefers to to resolve problems without falling back on violent solutions. However, fellow cattleman Wick Campbell (Richard Boone) isn't so peaceful, and he hires a team of armed mercenaries, led by ruthless Frank Scavo (Leo Gordon), to rid him of any possible competition. After narrowly surviving an attack from Scavo and his men, Stewart has little choice but to fight back in order to save both his ranch and his family, including nephew Howie (Skip Homeier).

programme.title: The Hard Man
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: Beyond the Sacramento
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) and Cannonball (Dub Taylor) save Lodestone from swindlers preparing a bond scam.

programme.title: The Outlaws Is Coming
programme.desc: Moe, Larry and Curly Joe (Adam West) bring their head-knocking, eye-gouging antics to the Wild West. When reporter Kenneth Cabot (Nancy Kovack) heads to Wyoming to stop the slaughter of buffaloes, he brings the stooges with him. There, they trade barbs with Billy the Kid, Jesse James and Wild Bill Hickock, while Cabot gets elected town sheriff. But they'll need some help from Annie Oakley (Mort Mills) when it comes to foiling the criminal plans of a land-hungry frontier villain.

programme.title: JK's House
programme.desc: Life lessons and family drama are doled out in song and dance in this family-friendly musical about a single doctor raising a young family.

programme.title: Best Friend From Heaven
programme.desc: When her dog is killed, Tara cancels her wedding. But her dog's ghost and her small town have a surprise.

programme.title: Anna Nicole
programme.desc: From teen mom and stripper to global sex symbol, here’s the life story of Anna Nicole’s meteoric rise and tragic losses that preceded her death at 39.

programme.desc: A Civil War vet makes peace with his losses and starts a new life with the world resisting change around him.

programme.desc: The newfound fame of a cop who publishes her first novel is tainted by the specific details in the book that are the exact same as a real murder case.

programme.title: Blood Ties
programme.desc: Vicki is forced to repeat the same day over and over as she searches for an antiquity: Pandora’s Box.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A conspiracy theorist with compelling information that JFK's own cabinet planned his assassination is murdered.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A boy suffering from PTSD undergoes hypnosis and realizes he may have witnessed a murder related to a 10-year-old cold case; Danny's sister visits Oahu.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team rushes to Mexico, where Chin puts his life in jeopardy in an effort to rescue Sara, his kidnapped niece.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Chin is kidnapped by a Mexican cartel, Five-0 must rescue him before he is executed by the vengeful group; Grover goes under cover to investigate a murder, which turns out to be far more complex and dangerous than anticipated.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The Five-0 must once again engage in the twisted mind games of serial killer Dr. Madison Gray when she arrives at the HPD covered in blood that matches Alicia Brown's.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: After tracking down the missing uranium, which has been used to build a bomb in the middle of the jungle, McGarrett and Danny must move the explosive material through treacherous terrain before it detonates.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSIs investigate the death of a college student whose body was found in a hot tub.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When Horatio tracks down a mysterious murder suspect, he discovers the man's life is a charade.

programme.desc: When the transport plane carrying a fugitive crash-lands, the CSIs learn the criminal is planning more than just an escape.

programme.title: CSI: Miami

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The discovery of a strange murder weapon leads the CSIs into the world of gigolos.

programme.title: CSI: Miami

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team pursues a killer who takes the eyes from victims; a new adversary challenges Horatio.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio must protect a Mexican police chief from the unknown assassin responsible for her husband's death.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a Navy contractor who secretly lived two lives for decades.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride is given a series of tasks to complete by unknown assailants who are holding Wade and his father hostage.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and the team hope to take down a secret and lethal group of former intelligence agents and avenge the death of someone close to them.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans

programme.desc: The team investigates multiple murders tied to a construction company that creates an experimental chemical that strengthens sea walls; evidence from Hannah's previous mission in Oman is used against her.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After an elusive terrorist with a personal vendetta against Hannah resurfaces, she and her family are placed in protective custody while the team searches for the suspect.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates the murder of Patton's friend, a former Navy SEAL gunned down in a drive-by shooting while Patton watched.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst the Upper Marshwood hunt assemble outside the village inn, a filthy tramp-like man leaves the shop and skulks into the wood. Soon after, he hears the sound of the hunt begin and the unforgettable noise of the horses and hounds in hot pursuit of the fox. Running for cover, towards the safety of his home-made shelter, he stumbles and falls into a pit - screaming. LIZA, isolated in the disused railway carriage which constitutes her home, moves deeper into the wood having heard the scream. She finds the pit and sees the tramp lying crumpled on the ground, clearly dead. She stares at him for a moment, then turns and walks away.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Wellow, someone is killing off the bell ringers of the parish church, in the week before a big bell-ringing competition. One young woman on the team is even shot dead in the churchyard on her wedding day.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy landowner Gregory Lancaster's body goes missing on the night of his death, a sinister web of secrets and lies is exposed in the village of Little Malton. DCI Barnaby, DS Nelson and new Forensic Pathologist Kam Karimore are drawn into a macabre world of body-snatching as they seek to identify the villain.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Mysterious lights are seen in the sky over famous UFO hot-spot Cooper Hill. When a local forest-ranger suffers a strange death the visiting UFO spotters are convinced aliens are responsible. DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson unearth suspicions, betrayals and long-buried secrets in their search for the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An international cycling competition comes to the Midsomer village of Burwood Mantle. When the race leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson find themselves drawn into a ruthlessly competitive world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed where winning comes at any cost.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Art comes to the picturesque Midsomer village of Angel's Rise with the opening of a new Sculpture Park. But when its launch is marred by murder, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to get creative to crack a case where art imitates death, and everything has a deeper meaning.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny impulsively buys a '69 Caddy and falls madly in love with her. Will he sell it for a big profit, or add her to his collection?

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A family brings in an old pickup truck to be restored in memory of their mom, and Danny needs to figure out how to build the perfect tribute vehicle, without blowing the budget.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny must do a full bumper-to-bumper restoration on a '66 Mustang convertible, but after stripping it down, he finds very little car between her bumpers; Danny must to decide between asking for more money or losing a bunch of his own.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is so proud of the van he restored as a gift for his bandmate John Zito, that he decides to give his own classic van a make-over.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the team continue wrestling with a stock restoration Mustang mess, hoping for extra funds and a lot of patience from their client; Kevin spots a rare old Grand Prix and Danny visits a world class specialist, looking for ideas.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A motorcycle-loving couple wants to hit the road like they used to, this time on a Count's Kustoms chopper.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has a customer who wants to restore a 1942 Ford truck that saw some action in WWII. But when Danny takes in the project he quickly learns it'll need a lot more.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Ryan and Kevin head to the Bonneville Salt Flats to see The Turbinator, a vehicle that holds a land speed record try to break 500 MPH.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has found and bought a replacement for his beloved Dune Buggy "Sparkles." As the guys are turning it into the ultimate 70s beach fantasy.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The shop has its hands full restoring a 1942 Ford truck that needed a lot of TLC and a special touch for the owner's wife. Danny and Ryan check out a badass 1929 Ford Roadster.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny's battle with nightmare Z28 continues as he puts it though endless fabrication to bring it back to life. While it's being revived, Danny takes a break.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the boys meet with a customer who wants a wicked paint job to match his wicked 1959 Anglia dragster.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Mike Joy looks through the differences between a resto mod and a custom.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The auction blocks see a diverse range of collector trucks, including Toyota Landcruisers, Chevy C10s, a GMC C10 and an F-150 SVT Raptor.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The 'Stangs take on the 'Vettes with examples from across all eras, and a few Thunderbirds and Plymouths thrown in for good measure.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: It's time to cowboy up and wrangle a winner as Broncos, Mustangs and Camaros stampede down the block of the Barrett-Jackson auction in Houston, Texas.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The Vegas strip heats up as a pair of Shelby Mustangs light up the Barrett-Jackson auction, selling at no reserve; a Boss 429 Mustang gallops into a block-busting bidding war.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Big bucks for Broncos and Mustangs as cowboys and cowgirls go head-to-head wrangling some of the best deals at the World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: It's Lamborghini versus everyone in Scottsdale, Ariz.; The World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions once again feature some of the most scintillating vehicles ever sold, including a Lamborghini Diablo owned by Danny Koker.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Big bucks for Broncos and Mustangs as cowboys and cowgirls go head-to-head wrangling some of the best deals at the World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: It's Lamborghini versus everyone in Scottsdale, Ariz.; The World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions once again feature some of the most scintillating vehicles ever sold, including a Lamborghini Diablo owned by Danny Koker.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Mike Joy looks through the differences between a resto mod and a custom.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The 'Stangs take on the 'Vettes with examples from across all eras, and a few Thunderbirds and Plymouths thrown in for good measure.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1923 Babe Ruth baseball card; a 1930s unrestored children's tricycle comes into the shop; Corey totals his truck and is forced to drive the company car with Rick's face on it.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A lunar Bible from Apollo 14; a 1930s Buck Rogers Disintegrator Gun; miniature samples of a 1950s kitchen; a 1950s Beetle Bailey original print.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A tree with an 1800s revolver inside it come in to the shop; Chumlee checks out a Renaissance etching by Pietro Facchetti.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A guitar owned by music legend Stephen Stills comes through the door; a 1800s detective's camera comes into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The shop is officially in session when excerpts from the first Continental Congress make their way in.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A cast jacket from "Pulp Fiction" arrives in the shop; opera gloves signed by Hollywood legend Clark Gable are brought in; Rick heads to Las Vegas legend Lonnie Hammargren's home to check out his collection.

programme.desc: Bullet shells from John Dillinger's final robbery get caught in the shop; Rick and Corey attempt to make a drive by deal on a vintage Schwinn Whizzer from 1947.

programme.desc: A trophy awarded to retired NBA basketball player Julius "Dr. J" Erving; a WWII bombsight; some antique quack medicine bottles; a little coin nicknamed the Scarface.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Stumped on a way to celebrate Willie's birthday, Korie enlists the guys' help and Jase takes the reigns in planning a trip to the lake where Phil and Kay used to live.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie takes a business trip to Scotland to expand his duck call business, he brings the entire family along so they can reconnect with their Scottish roots.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A special holiday episode of Duck Dynasty shows when the Robertson family took over the Thanksgiving special of a local TV show "Good Morning Arklamiss."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes the temporary owner of a thoroughbred, he and the guys take it to a local track and enter it into a race.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons help a long time employee whose Mom has fallen on hard times by buying her a brand new house for Christmas. Jep, Jase, Martin and Godwin race to finish a deck in time for the big reveal, only to get sidetracked by a hammering competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase enters an outhouse race to help promote Willie's Duck Diner, but when the Robertsons show up for the race, they face an unexpected rival -- Phillip McMillan. Meanwhile, Willie attempts to create the world's greatest bologna sandwich for his Duck Diner menu, and enlists the help of the ladies to be his "taste testers."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie helps Sadie with her homework by enlisting the guys to create a real-life version of a math problem, but when Jase and Willie get sidetracked helping Sadie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep asks Willie and the guys to help move his old chicken coop into his new house, which is under renovation, Jessica takes issue with its appearance, leading the guys to yet another project.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes an assistant coach on Lil' Will's struggling football team, his authority is tested when the kids challenge the adults to a scrimmage. Meanwhile, Kay brings Jep and Si to an aquarobics class at a local health club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys transform an old pontoon boat into a floating duck blind, they are faced with the impending question of whether or not it will actually float. Meanwhile, when Kay's dog Bobo misbehaves, Willie signs Kay and Bobo up for a doggie obedience class.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep and Jessica move into Willie and Jase's neighborhood, Jep is sidelined with an illness, causing Willie and the Robertson family to pitch in and help Jessica get her new house ready in time for Jep's arrival home.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and the guys take John Luke golfing prior to his engagement party, their attempts at marital advice don't exactly work out as planned.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase receives a palate of fireworks as a gift, he and the guys create a homemade fireworks display for the Robertson family 4th of July barbeque. Meanwhile, Uncle Si is honored by the veterans association and given his own exhibit at a local military museum.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil and Jase get into an argument about which type of duck decoy works best, Jase and the guys repaint some old decoys, betting that Phil cannot tell the difference. Meanwhile, Jessica challenges Willie to a bowling contest with Kay's "Big Sista's" club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys discover they have a knack for removing pests from other people's property, they use their new talents to their advantage. Meanwhile, Willie gives Sadie and John Luke summer jobs at his diner, but first he must train them to be good employees.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When an office prank war spirals out of control, Phil volunteers Willie, Jase, and Jep to help Alan at the church, which seems more like a punishment than charity work. Meanwhile, Korie gives Kay a surprise art class taught by famous artist Pierre Matisse.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the guys spend the weekend at a hunting cabin to celebrate Martin's bachelor party, things turns explosive after they find a cache of antique black powder weapons. Meanwhile, Willie helps Kay fulfill her lifelong dream of owning a petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Uncle Si has a brush with death, he creates a bucket list and asks the guys to help him fulfill his dreams. Meanwhile, Kay sets out to prove to Willie and Alan that she actually graduated high school.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Duck Commander sponsors a NASCAR race, Jase and the guys get themselves in the mood by attempting to work as a pit crew. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie challenge John Luke and his fianc Mary Kate to a doubles tennis match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
